page.title: 06TOPICAL ISSUES IN OAKHAM
page.content:
Extracts from the{Rutland and Stamford {Mercury,}Friday May 10th, 1985.
The Ancient {Market Cross}where intinerant preachers stood to harangue, and people gathered to buy and sell butter, is under attack from the 20th century. It is regulary hit by vehicles. The cobbles are torn up by the motorbikes parked there and the tiled roof is in danger of slipping loose. The town council have called an emergency meeting in a bid to arrive at a solution.
A BBC film unit has visited {Markon {Engineering}to film a special computer being used to design new products. As well as being used for a series of training videos, the film will also feature in documentary on computers in industry to be screened on BBC 2.
